title.narrative: GAP phase 2, Min for HR and Refugees (FIGAP)

description.narrative: Stöd till Bosnien och Hercegovinas jämställdhetsmyndighet (Gender Equality Agency på statlig nivå och två myndigheter på entitetsnivå). Målet med insatsen är att genom standardiserad jämställdhetsintegrering uppnå att allmänna beslut förbättrar villkoren för kvinnor, män, flickor och pojkar i Bosnien på ett jämställt sett och att en standardiserad jämtälldhetsintegrering i BiH sker på ett öppet, ansvarstagande, jämställt och inkluderande sätt genom programmet (FIGAP2)

Support to the gender mechanisms of Bosnia och Herzegovina (Gender Equality Agency on state level and two gender centers on entity level). The objective of the contribution is to have a standardised gender mainstreaming in BiH in order to reach a situation where public decisions improve the conditions for women, men, girls and boys equally. The standardized gender mainstreaming should be done through a transparent, accountable, equitable and inclusive programme (FIGAP2).

The intervention aims at - "public decisions to improve the conditions of women, men, girls and boys equally". This should be done by standardisation of gender mainstreaming in Bosnia and Herzegovina (through transparent, accountable, equitable and participatory FIGAP2). There are four objectives of the programme, which all aims at improving gender equality aspects of public decisions in BiH: 1. An accountable GE policy framework in FIGAP priority areas (GBV, Economic Empowerment, public participation) 2. Capable GM structures for GE that perform according to their mandate 3. Effective systems that support the accepted GM approach 4. Competent and sustainable staff contingency in BiH to promote and manage GM agenda

sector.narrative: Women’s rights organisations and movements, and government institutions

tag.narrative: 5.1 - Avskaffa alla former av diskriminering av alla kvinnor och flickor överallt
5.1 - End all forms of discrimination against all women and girls everywhere.
5.c - Adopt and strengthen sound policies and enforceable legislation for the promotion of gender equality and the empowerment of all women and girls at all levels.
5.c - Anta och stärka välgrundad politik och genomförbar lagstiftning för att främja jämställdhet och öka alla kvinnors och flickors egenmakt på alla nivåer

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: The first objective about gender-responsive policies is tightly connected to the mandets of the Gender Institutional Mechanisms (GIMs), since it is about providing input, opinions and suggestions to new laws, regulations and policies. What the FIGAP II programme adds to this process relates to the external studies and resources that are realised thanks to the programme. GIMs' use these in their opinions and suggestions on the various regulations, hence better input in relation to gender equality is provided towards new legislation, policy and regulations. In 2020, various studies, analyses, guidelines have been provided, which will serve to further create gender-responsive policies and measures at all levels of government in BiH. GIMs have also monitored the implementation of given suggestions and opinions. The second objective about capable gender mainstreaming structures, targets the various groups, committees and boards in the public administration which are outside AGE and the Gender Centres, such as gender focal points in line ministries, the gender committee in the parliament, etc. During the previous period, the GIMs have significantly contributed to capacity building of institutions at all levels of government in BiH, through professional support. FIGAP II also contributes to strengthen the coordination between the GIMs through joint planning, monitoring and reporting about the programme. This is a good example of contributing to collaboration and coordination, which Sida should emphasies the importance of. We know from before that this is a delicate and often difficult task within the FIGAP programme, but a very important one. The third objective about effective systems to support the introduction and implementation of gender equality standards aims at improving systems for statistics, gender responsive budgeting, communication/promotion (related to media), grant mechanisms to institutions and NGO's. FIGAP II have, among other things, worked with the HJPC to improve a case management system in the judiciary to include data on victims and perpetrators of gender based violence and femicide. Gender Responsive Budgeting (GRB) has been improved, much thanks to UN Women's support. Various NGOs have been granted for different projects that contribute to FIGAP II and GAP objetives. The fourth objective about capable and sustainable professional capacitites in BiH to introduce, implement and promote gender mainstreaming targets the GIMs themselves and their internal capacities. For example, the FIGAP II has contributed to a database of external gender experts which have been used by the GIMs. The report states that FIGAP II has contributed to fulfilment of the obligations and mandates of the GIM, which due to a chronic lack of human resources would not be able to meet all their tasks, especially in crisis management during a pandemic. When it comes to covid-19, GIMs have tried to respond to the crisis through focusing on support to the most vulnerable.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
